result.execSummary:
The defendant Cynthia L. Hillman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to report to Probation January 13, 2017 by 3:30 p.m.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

From DE on 1/6/2020 requesting a Pymt Plan. Ret'd call to DE today & advised her that as of now, her bal is still collectible by Probation. DE stated that she was advised by her Probation Agent that the court would contact her to set up a Pymt Plan, but the DE has since spoken to Jodi (JA's Office) who advised her that that wasn't necessarily the protocol but she may contact C of C to inquire. DE was advised that there is currently an unsigned Order with the judge & if he signs that, we will take the debt back from Probation, enter a jmt against her, & mail her a copy of the jmt along w/a Collection (SDC) notice giving her 30 days to pay or set up a Pymt Plan. DE to submit a change of address ASAP (16CF is correct, 15CM case is incorrect) & call back @ the end of next wk to ck status of her cases. DE advised she may make a pymt here in the meantime & that we will notify DOC if needed. Includes 15CM738, 16CF38. jaf

CO: Vlack, DAR: Gross, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Karl E. Anderson   DF ATTY: Donna Burger for Joseph Robert Caton   DF:  Cynthia L. Hillman appeared. Includes 15CM738 and 16CF38. Case called at 3:42 pm. ADA Anderson recites agreement. No objection from Atty Burger. Court questions.   Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Defendant understands and pleads Guilty to Count #1 on 15CM738, Count #1 and Count #5 in 16CF38. Court questions Defendant.  Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights.  Attorneys stipulate to facts.  Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts.  Court finds Defendant Guilty of Count #1 in 15CM738 and Count #5 in 16CF38. Court witholds entering conviction in Count #1 in 16CF38 in favor of Diversion Agreement. Atty's make sentencing arguments. Defendant makes statement.  On Count #1 in 15CM738 and Count #5 in 16CF38 - Court orders: 2 yrs probation w/h
- 120 Days Jail STAYED
- Court Costs
- Restitution - Apply Money on file
- DNA Sample and Surcharge
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Not to possess a firearm
- Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license
- Restortative Justice
- Maintain Employment
- Defendant shall appear in court on 4/24/217
- Comply with terms of DJOC on Count #1 in 16CF38
- Sign up for probation by 3:30 pm on 1/13/2017
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees
Court orders money on file to be paid out to victim

Status conference at 03-29-2016 04:15 pm

Prior to leaving the courthouse, report to St Croix County Jail for mugshots and fingerprints.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Robert or Lois B.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
